errors.description: Raised when the parser encounters a syntax error.
Raised when there is an incorrect indentation.
Raised when an operation or function is applied to an object of inappropriate type.
Raised when a local or global name is not found.
Raised when a sequence subscript is out of range.
Raised when a dictionary key is not found.
Raised when a function receives an argument of the right type but inappropriate value.
Raised when an attribute reference or assignment fails.
Raised when an import statement fails to find the module definition or when a from ... import fails to find a name that is to be imported.
Raised when a module could not be located.
Raised when the second argument of a division or modulo operation is zero.
